title: Understanding Spontaneity
text: A reaction is spontaneous when it can proceed without any external intervention. This often depends both on enthalpy (ΔH) and entropy (ΔS) changes.

title: The Role of Enthalpy and Entropy
text: The spontaneity of a reaction relies on the Gibbs Free Energy equation: ΔG $$=$$ ΔH - TΔS.

title: Understanding ΔG for Spontaneity
text: A reaction is spontaneous when its ΔG is negative.

title: Considering Negative ΔS
text: If ΔS is negative, then -TΔS is positive, making the term's influence on spontaneity dependent on ΔH.

hintAnswer: ΔH must be negative and $$\Delta H<T\Delta S$$
title: Condition for Spontaneity when ΔS is Negative
text: Given that ΔS is negative, the change in enthalpy ΔH must be negative and sufficiently large such that ΔH < TΔS.
choices: The enthalpy change (ΔH) must be positive and greater than TΔS
The enthalpy change (ΔH) must be negative and less than TΔS
The enthalpy change (ΔH) must be zero
The enthalpy change (ΔH) must be positive
Spontaneous at any temperature without considering ΔH
